description: As the two countries continue to strike each other, Israel is faced with a lack of shelters, particularly in Arab communities.

'Impossible to sleep before 3 am': France swelters under summer's first heatwave
description: Temperatures have neared or exceeded 35°C in several parts of France, often running 10°C to 15°C above seasonal averages. On Saturday, the heat is expected to intensify, reaching up to 40°C in parts of the South and West.

headline: Paris extends summer bar and restaurant terrace hours, angering noise-weary neighbors
description: The measure, which starts on June 21 and lasts until September 14, also faces criticism from right-wing and centrist opposition members on the city council of the French capital.

headline: Ludovico Einaudi, the Italian pianist turned neoclassical star
description: The Italian musician's tranquil pieces have turned him into the genre's major star. Ahead of his upcoming Paris show on June 21, Le Monde met with him at his home in the town of Dogliani, near Turin.

headline: Theodor Meron: 'Sometimes the worst atrocities produce the most significant changes in the law'
description: In an interview with Le Monde, the expert at the International Criminal Court defends the work of law enforcement agencies, particularly in the war in Gaza.

Five years later, the 'hangover' of the French citizens who took part in the Convention for the Climate
description: On June 21, 2020, 150 randomly selected citizens submitted 149 proposals to the government. Since then, some have shifted careers to work on environmental issues, while others have moved on.

headline: Chinese cities are facing the financial abyss of their subway systems
description: After high-speed rail, subway lines are now dragging the cities they serve into huge levels of debt. This is due to colossal construction and operating costs, minimal revenues and a toxic relationship with real estate developers.

headline: How close is Iran to having nuclear weapons?
description: Israel has bombed strategic sites in Iran, which it said could soon produce a nuclear weapon. Tehran had announced it was increasing its production of enriched uranium, amid stalled talks with the United States.
byline: Manon Romain,  Pierre Breteau and  Zoé Multeau
